triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are the primary system being controlled in this work for consensus tracking missions.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: Consensus tracking control enables multiple UAVs to reach agreement on a common tracking objective through distributed control.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory provides the mathematical foundation for designing the prescribed performance control approach.

triples.name: Fuzzy control system
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an adaptive fuzzy fault compensation mechanism to handle motor faults in UAVs.

triples.name: Human-in-the-loop
triples.relevance: The paper proposes incorporating human decision-making into UAV control as a novel hybrid active interaction approach.

triples.name: Fault tolerance
triples.relevance: Fault compensation ensures UAV flight safety when motors experience faults in harsh environments.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: Adaptive control techniques enable the system to adjust parameters in response to changing conditions and motor faults.
